dublin_core.dcvalue: AIM To determine if patients in cardiology practices would be interested in or willing to use mobile health technologies METHODS Patients seen at an ambulatory cardiology clinic for any indication were included A paper survey was administered during pre intake that assessed frequency of use familiarity with and interest in mobile health applications Data were analyzed using an exploratory logistic regression analysis to determine demographic predictors for technology utilization RESULTS A total of 306 patients were included a plurality 39 3 in age group 50 69 62 7 male Those from median household incomes between US 30 000 and US 74 999 and those 18 29 years old were more likely to have used a health app 0 53 and 1 21 respectively Those between 18 and 29 years were less interested in virtual visits with their healthcare provider 0 92 and those over age 70 were less comfortable using their phone apps 0 80 CONCLUSION Age and income are important predictors of mobile health app adoption
Mobile health apps preferences and practice among ambulatory cardiovascular patients.
